question:
What does the following command do? 
SELECT column1,MAX.column2.
FROM table_name
GROUP BY column1
HAVING MAX.column2.>=5;
option1: extract those values from 'column1' which have five or more 'column2'
option2: extract those values from 'column1' which occurs five or more times
option3: extract those values from 'column2' which occurs five or more times

question: Which two Queries will give same results :-
option1:
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE buyPrice >= 90 AND buyPrice <= 100;
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE buyPrice NOT BETWEEN 90 AND 100;
option2:
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE price >= 23 AND price <= 89;
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE price NOT BETWEEN 1 AND 20 AND BETWEEN 23 AND 106;
option3:
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE price >= 23 OR price <= 89;
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE price NOT BETWEEN 1 AND 20 OR BETWEEN 23 AND 106;
option4:
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE buyPrice >= 90 AND buyPrice <= 100;
SELECT productName FROM products WHERE buyPrice BETWEEN 90 AND 100;

option1: SELECT customernumber, customername, creditlimit FROM customers LIMIT 10;
option2: SELECT customernumber, customername, creditlimit FROM customers LIMIT 10,10;
option3: SELECT customernumber, customername, creditlimit FROM customers LIMIT Start 1, END 10;
option4: SELECT customernumber, customername, creditlimit FROM customers LIMIT 10,0;
